Cybercriminals are getting smarter, using AI-powered attacks to manipulate, deceive, and disrupt. From deepfake executive impersonations to convincing phishing emails, the threats evolving rapidly.

 <https://onechalhoubmedia.connexionsnow.com/b79f984f0713ceb12a3d438c6f488e96267455323.png> 	
 <https://onechalhoubmedia.connexionsnow.com/d5daeaa4d042b4944ed9e17408ec21d61115657366.png> 	
 <https://onechalhoubmedia.connexionsnow.com/962252cc444f6776e1b8452a91a92d7e421531170.png> 	
 <https://onechalhoubmedia.connexionsnow.com/e487a6f15dd779063c4d7aacd0763365618970348.png> 	

1.	Phishing â€” The #1 method attackers use to breach organizations. 
2.	Ransomware â€” Cybercriminals hold data hostage for financial gain. 
3.	Malware â€” Designed to steal, spy, or damage systems.
4.	Denial of Service (DoS) â€” Overwhelming systems to cause outages. 
5.	Cloud Vulnerabilities â€” Targeting misconfigured cloud systems. 

 <https://onechalhoubmedia.connexionsnow.com/3bc36f21984a09fdceccebb2ec788ff21123867704.png>

Our defences intercepted over:
